---
title: "yojoa heat map"
author: "Matthew Ross"
date: "2/22/2019"
output: html_document
---

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(sf) #use instead of sp
library(mapview)
library(lubridate)
library(osmdata)
library(raster) #matt says not to use
library(sp) #also dead
library(gstat)

```


# Data read
```{r}
# Read in points (OSM data)
y <- read_csv('data/Yojoaheatmapfile.csv') 
head(y)  

#convert to spatial object
ys <- st_as_sf(y,coords=c('longitude','latitude'),crs=4326) 

#extract coordinates after projecting onto local projection
ys.m <- st_transform(ys,crs=26716) %>%
  mutate(x=st_coordinates(.)[,1],
         y=st_coordinates(.)[,2])

# Get state metadata (getbb-- get bounding box)
bb <- getbb('Santa Barbara, Honduras')

#Download Lago de Yojoa
lake <- opq(bbox=bb) %>%
add_osm_feature(key = 'natural', value = 'water') %>%
  osmdata_sf() %>%
  .$osm_polygons %>%
  filter(name == 'Lago de Yojoa') %>%
  st_transform(26716)

#Get bboxx info for yojoa
yo_box <- st_bbox(lake)

mapview(ys,zcol='Cu_mg_kg')+
  mapview(lake)+
  mapview(yo_box)
```


## Make a heatmap--old way
```{r}
#matt converted everything back to spatial bc he didn't know how to work with sf data
lake.sp <- as(lake,'Spatial')
lake.raster <- raster(lake.sp,res=100)
g <- as(lake.raster,'SpatialGrid')

y.sp <- as(ys.m,'Spatial')

metals = c('Cu_mg_kg','Zn_mg_kg','Cd_mg_kg','Pb_mg_kg')

for(i in 1:length(metals)){
  
  formula = as.formula(paste(metals[i], 1,sep='~'))
  cu_s <- gstat(id=metals[i],formula=formula,data=y.sp)
  z <- interpolate(lake.raster,cu_s) %>% round(.,1)
  #mask out anything that's not open water
  z <- mask(z,lake.sp)
  #make interactive map
  cu <- mapview(z,na.col=NA,col.regions=mapviewGetOption('vector.palette')) + 
    mapview(ys.m,zcol=metals[i])
  #save as html
  mapshot(cu,url=paste0(metals[i],'.html'))
}

```

# The New Way

```{r}
library(stars)
#STARS = spatial temporal arrays, new way to work w raster data in R (stack in time)
#terra looks a lot more like raster package

lake_stars<- st_bbox(lake) %>%
  st_as_stars(dx=100) %>%
  st_crop(lake)

interp = idw(Zn_mg_kg~1, y.sp, lake_stars)

mapview(interp, na.col=NA, col.regions=mapviewGetOption("vector.palette"))+
  mapview(y.sp,zcol = "Zn_mg_kg")

```

## Variogram

```{r}
#tells you how the value of interest changes as you get farther from site
v_zn<- variogram(Zn_mg_kg ~ 1, y.sp)

v.m = fit.variogram(v_zn, vgm(1, "Exp",50,1))
plot(v_zn, v.m, plot.numbers=TRUE)

```

## Make a heatmap
